description: NOW INCLUDES FREE INDOOR WINTER STORAGE UNTIL 4-1-17. I've arranged inside storage of the boat until April 1, 2017 and will include this in the sale if the boat is purchased now! Also included is winterization of the boat which has now been completed. Permission has been given so that the boat can be viewed while in storage anytime the marine facility is open. DRASTIC REDUCTION TO GET THIS BOAT SOLD NOW! I HAVE FAR MORE INVESTED THAN THE ASKING PRICE, WHICH IS A STEAL CONSIDERING THE COST OF RESTORATION. COMPARE THIS TO ANY OTHER 24' BOW RIDER OF THIS ERA; THIS IS THE REAL DEAL FOLKS! Up for sale is a beautifully restored 2007 Regal 2400 open-bow family day-boat in off white with black coves and no bottom paint ever. This boat has been was in restoration mode for 6 months during 2016 and it's now ready for sale. The boat only has 110 original hours on it, according to the hour meter, and it features a Volvo Penta 5.7 GXi engine yielding 320 prop horsepower with a new Duo Prop outdrive (16 hours of use). However, the former owner allowed the boat to sit outside exposed to the weather which necessitated replacement of many items. The following items were replaced or restored: 01) New risers, manifolds, and gaskets ($1,445.95) 02) New starter motor ($358.28) 03) New water pump ($422.94) 04) New (not rebuilt) Volvo-Penta Duo-Prop 1:95:1 outdrive w/stainless steel props ($3,834) 05) New gimbal ring powder coating and bell housing service ($447.20) 06) New bellows, gasket, wear pad, bushing, fitting for out-drive ($159.38) 07) New trim pump ($1,321.64) 08) New serpentine belt and tensioner ($133.80) 09) New Fire Boy 100 c.f. halon automatic fire suppression unit ($440.00) 10) New batteries (2) ($233.90) 11) New fuel fill hose (113.45) 12) New thermostat and gasket ($40.53) 13) New spark plugs ($145.26) 14) New distributor cap and rotor ($109.45) 15) New fuel cell assembly ($928.75) 16) New 32 oz. marine vinyl interior ($3,270.00) 17) New Wise 8WD 1217 series bucket helm seats w/bolster ($692.52) 18) New Garelick Eez-In Millennium series swivel/slide mounts (2) ($211.90) 19) New Gussi stainless steel and faux burl wood steering wheel ($113.86) 20) New Regal steering wheel center cap monogram ($19.98) 21) New Kenwood stereo speakers (2) ($38.98) 22) New Igloo 25 quart Marine Ultra Cooler ($34.28) 23) New Contura II rocker switch actuator covers (8) ($43.37) 24) New refinishing for rocker switch panels ($50.00) 25) New 50 watt stainless steel docking lights-pair ($86.57) 26) New Sea Dog door stop bumper and Perko deck key ($14.01) 27) New vented hole plugs ($4.85) 28) New marine red/green LED navigation light-2 mile ($21.45) 29) New rubber insert dash pad ($18.80) 30) New stainless steel marine sink drains-pro grade (2) ($22.00) 31) New Trac T10012 automatic bilge pump-1100 GPH ($46.99) 32) New adjustable aluminum mooring cover support pole ($29.95) 33) New Regal O.E.M bow area carpet runner; rubber-backed ($120.37) 34) New Perko flush-latch-white-D ring ($36.49) 35) New 12 volt outlet ($12.70) 36) New ITC stainless steel single-handle faucet ($67.95) 37) New 5 lb. Kidde hand-held fire extinguisher ($10.57) 38) New light-weight travel cover for 24' boat ($160.99) 39) New miscellaneous stainless steel nuts and bolts ($52.17) 40) New marine kill switch lanyard cord ($2.92) 41) New miscellaneous sealers, liquids, paint, sandblasting, etc. ($86.52) 42) New side graphics ($175.00) 43) Complete interior/exterior rubbing out, polishing, and waxing of boat ($1,500) 44) Bimini top pole clip holders ($19.96) In case you would prefer to skip the math, the total restoration came to $18,123.23. I DO HAVE all the receipts for the work and parts I've outlined. This does not include any compensation for my personal labor to install these parts and restore this boat. All the restoration work, except for the work which was done just before I purchased the boat in April, 2016, was completed between April and September of 2016. The boat was not used by us in 2016 whatsoever due to the restoration process. The restoration total does not include the price that I paid for the boat originally. Some of the notable features are: patented "Fastrac" hull for faster planing and better fuel economy, wrap-around cockpit seating, bow filler cushions, wind-block door, stainless steel windshield header, pressure water system, transom fresh-water shower, enclosed head compartment with pump-out portable toilet, multiple stainless steel drink holders, large in-floor ski/wake board storage locker, extended swim platform, front 3 step and rear 4 step stainless steel fold-out ladders, front anchor locker, black Sunbrella bow and cockpit covers, Bimini top w/storage boot & stainless steel frame, Kenwood Sirius-ready CD stereo system w/4 speakers, iPod connection, & transom remote, cockpit sink w/fresh water faucet, removable 25 quart Igloo cooler, dual batteries w/Perko selector switch, tilt steering wheel, power steering, full instrumentation w/red night lighting, digital depth finder, LED interior courtesy lights, removable stern light, snap-in bow & cockpit carpeting, compass, stainless steel bow scuff plate, 3-door swim platform storage/cooler compartment with drain, tremendous under-seat storage, engine flush kit, and recessed pop-up cleats. Included is a used Wesco 10,000 lb. GVW dual-axle bunk trailer with rear load guides and diamond plate fenders valued at $2,000. When all this is added up, the grand total is thousands above my asking price. I believe someone will get an awesome value for their hard-earned dollar when they purchase this boat! PLEASE DO NOT TEXT ME! Text messages will be politely ignored; if you're serious about looking at the boat please call me. Furthermore, I DO NOT NEED HELP SELLING MY BOAT; I'm quite capable of handling this on my own. Shipping cost is the buyer's responsibility. PayPal or personal checks not accepted; cash or certified check only.
title: REDUCED!-2007 Regal 2400-tandem trailer-$18K restoration

The J-193's eighteen foot length gives it exceptional tracking ability combined with the blazing speed that Gene Jensen's designs are famous for. description: Fall Special 1985 Tollycraft 26 Flybridge Sedan with Trailer Low Hours Fall special **Bring your best offer! This boat is ready to go with recent Market Analysis** Kirstie Marie (KM) is one of the newest of a long line of very well built boats. She is a very clean and roomy Low Hour Fresh Water Pocket Trawler with Trailer (ready to trailer ANYwhere) that was purchased and launched in the Detroit area before moving to Lake Superior in 1992 for many years where she was upgraded and outfitted to modern standards. I purchased KM in 2011 and cruised her to Lake Michigan via the Soo Locks, St Mary's River, Mackinac Island and the Eastern shore. In 2013 I trailered her back to the Detroit area where she has been moored ever since. As a Naval Architect I chose KM for her like new condition, solid construction, spacious and modern interior and the fact she was outfitted as a modern day pocket trawler with low hours that I could trailer anywhere and she has exceeded all of my expectations. Specs -LOA: 26'10" -Beam: 10' -Draft: 32" -9,000 lbs Power -Crusader 5.7L with V-Drive transmission and 614 Original Low Hours -Impeller changed every 2 years -Fluids changed annually Navigation/Electronics -(2010 upgrade) Raymarine C80 Chartplotter display with integrated fishfinder/depth/and radar -Bridge Helm Compass (Danforth Dual Display -- new 2012) Electrical -3 Group 27 Batteries (2 starting / house, 1 Windlass) -(2010 upgrade) 2 bank battery charger Galley -AC/DC Fridge with Freezer -Stove with Oven (like new) -Stainless steel sink with hot/cold pressure water Water System -(upgrade) Pressure Water (new pump 2013) -(upgrade) Fresh Water Wash-down (new pump 2013) -Hot water tank Head -Full head with toilet, stainless steel sink and shower (curtain never used) Canvas and Cockpit -Bridge Cover (sunbrella serviced annually) -Bimini (light use) with cover -Helmsman seat (rebuilt 2012) plus seating for four -VHF Radio (new 2011) -New window covers (sunbrella) Accommodations -Teak finish in like new condition -All cushions/countertops in like new condition -(2010 upgrade) Installed heat (from engine) Mooring and Safety -(upgrade)Lewmar windlass with bridge remote -(upgrade) reinforced bow sprit with CQR (plow) anchor -(upgrade) new bilge pump (2013) -Fire suppression system with monitor Trolling Motor -9.9 hp Yamaha (less than 5 hours)  with cover - Remote start and steering -(upgrade)Electric tilt (2010) Extras -Brand new Electronic Distributor ready to be installed -Extra fuel filters, hardware, etc -Full set of spare engine belts Trailer -2 axle trailer (2012: new axles, new tires plus spare, new electric brakes all rated for 14,000lbs) -Trailer is well balanced for tongue weight, weighed in 2011 and licensed -Ready to travel ANYwhere Will take your best offer to find her a good new home port (updated market analysis of $27,345 available upon request)
